title: Stochastic Causal Programming for Bounding Treatment Effects. (arXiv:2202.10806v4 [stat.ML] UPDATED)
abstract: Causal effect estimation is important for many tasks in the natural and social sciences. We design algorithms for the continuous partial identification problem: bounding the effects of multivariate, continuous treatments when unmeasured confounding makes identification impossible. Specifically, we cast causal effects as objective functions within a constrained optimization problem, and minimize/maximize these functions to obtain bounds. We combine flexible learning algorithms with Monte Carlo methods to implement a family of solutions under the name of stochastic causal programming. In particular, we show how the generic framework can be efficiently formulated in settings where auxiliary variables are clustered into pre-treatment and post-treatment sets, where no fine-grained causal graph can be easily specified. tldr: 提出了一种名为随机因果编程的方法，用于解决多变量、连续治疗的因果效应的边界问题，该方法结合了灵活的学习算法和蒙特卡罗方法，能在无法测量混淆的情况下有效解决这种问题。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a method called stochastic causal programming to address the issue of bounding the effects of multivariate, continuous treatments when unmeasured confounding makes identification impossible. This method combines flexible learning algorithms with Monte Carlo methods and can efficiently formulate the problem in settings where no fine-grained causal graph can be easily specified.
